item.title: lowercase <-> uppercase
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: Variable-Case’s unique trait lies in its ability to switch between uppercase and lowercase letters based on where they sit vertically. I made a website to see the font in action. * Font testing site here vanghoa.github.io/VariableCase.* Take a look at the github repository.
item.content:encoded:
Variable-Case’s unique trait lies in its ability to switch between uppercase and lowercase letters based on where they sit vertically. I made a website to see the font in action.

* Font testing site here vanghoa.github.io/VariableCase.
* Take a look at the github repository.

  • Bảo Anh as graphic designer
  • Darius Ou for consultation
  • This project was done as part of a course module at LASALLE College of the Arts

item.title: LED text under Singapore MRT
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: A school study of localized text display technology on LED screen as well as the font rasterization method developed throughout the history of SMRT trains in SG. Various intriguing letterforms and typeface categories/treatments are documented.
item.content:encoded:
A school study of localized text display technology on LED screen as well as the font rasterization method developed throughout the history of SMRT trains in SG.

Various intriguing letterforms and typeface categories/treatments are documented.

  • Bảo Anh as photographer and graphic designer
  • Timothy Wee as instructor
  • Work done at LASALLE College of the Arts

item.title: Love is Hard, HIV Prevention is Easy website
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: UI/UX design for a public health campaign website to raise awareness about HIV prevention, reduce new HIV infections, and eliminate HIV stigma in Vietnam–Love is Hard, HIV Prevention is Easy. The website acts as an online repository for the public audience to learn about the issues and the campaign itself. Visit yeumoikho.com to see website.
item.content:encoded:
UI/UX design for a public health campaign website to raise awareness about HIV prevention, reduce new HIV infections, and eliminate HIV stigma in Vietnam–Love is Hard, HIV Prevention is Easy. The website acts as an online repository for the public audience to learn about the issues and the campaign itself.

Visit yeumoikho.com to see website.

  • Bảo Anh as UI/UX designer
  • Khê Nguyễn as UI/UX designer
  • Trang Đinh as UI/UX designer
  • Tuân Lê as Creative director
  • Digitop for web development
  • Work done as part of ‘LOVE IS HARD. HIV PREVENTION IS EASY.’ communication campagin by The Lab Saigon

item.title: Vietnamme Magazine
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: Vietnamme, an art organization in Vietnam, had been proposing the idea of a web magazine platform dedicated to exploring how the youth redefine and push the boundaries of art, irrespective of its form. I’m initially tasked with producing digital illustrations for two articles within the magazine.
item.content:encoded:
Vietnamme, an art organization in Vietnam, had been proposing the idea of a web magazine platform dedicated to exploring how the youth redefine and push the boundaries of art, irrespective of its form. I’m initially tasked with producing digital illustrations for two articles within the magazine.

  • Bảo Anh as website co-developer, website designer and illustrator
  • Diệu Ly as website co-developer and graphic designer
  • Minh Anh, and My Hà as graphic designer
  • Minh Phương, Anh Huy, and Chi Doan as illustrator
  • Vietnamme Magazine team for other content, and copy

item.title: on Swiss Design
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: Swiss Grid has long been a solemn pillar within the graphic design discipline. However, compared to itself half a century ago, the Grid system in the 21st century has evolved into, more or less flexible and dynamic. Today I look into the contemporary application of the Grid by researching both visually and textually on a […]
item.content:encoded:
Swiss Grid has long been a solemn pillar within the graphic design discipline. However, compared to itself half a century ago, the Grid system in the 21st century has evolved into, more or less flexible and dynamic. Today I look into the contemporary application of the Grid by researching both visually and textually on a Swiss graphic designer duo, Kasper Florio for a better insight into how that tool is intensively practiced based on a variety of typographic standards in the industry.

I’m so happy that it received the TDC and the Red Dot in 2021!

  • Bảo Anh as visual designer and copywriter Chen Michael as instructor
  • Yellow Type Foundry for Xanh Mono & Darker Grotesque typefaces
  • Design Boom for interviewing content
  • AIGAEyeonDesign for interviewing content
  • Ligature for interviewing content
  • Work done at LASALLE College of the Arts
  • Printing done at Pixel Tech Pte Ltd

item.title: Google Translate: Uncut
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: This is an entry for the D&AD New Blood competition in 2023, under the Google Fonts & HMCT brief. The brief was about creating a typographically-led campaign that is a call to action or raises awareness of a selected social issue.
item.content:encoded:
This is an entry for the D&AD New Blood competition in 2023, under the Google Fonts & HMCT brief. The brief was about creating a typographically-led campaign that is a call to action or raises awareness of a selected social issue.

  • Bảo Anh as motion/animation designer and graphic designer
  • Pauline Theodora Tandiah as graphic designer and voice actor
  • Tiara Rivera as graphic designer
  • Felix Sng, David Lee, and Jaygo Bloom for consultation
  • This project was done as part of a course module at LASALLE College of the Arts

item.title: trămđốt
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: After the closure of Ươm, a renowned hangout in Saigon’s creative scene, its founder, ltlt.company, has transitioned its legacy into the digital world with their latest cultural platform, trămđốt. trămđốt design tries capture the nostalgic aesthetics of massively multiplayer online games (MMOs) from the 2010s. These games, including titles like Club Penguin or the Vietnamese […]
item.content:encoded:
After the closure of Ươm, a renowned hangout in Saigon’s creative scene, its founder, ltlt.company, has transitioned its legacy into the digital world with their latest cultural platform, trămđốt.

trămđốt design tries capture the nostalgic aesthetics of massively multiplayer online games (MMOs) from the 2010s. These games, including titles like Club Penguin or the Vietnamese equivalents like Online Gunny and Bang Bang, were immensely popular among our generation.

For social media, I created this fun create-your-own-ASCII web for the audience to have their personalized ASCII person, using our idiosyncratic font. You can try here https://nguoi.tramdot.app/

It’s nice that it created a lot of attention. Thanks to all the friends to try on our small little fun mascot.

  • Bao Anh as graphic designer
  • Hải Phan & Tùng Sơn Lê as web developers
  • Duy Anh & Lê Minh as project director
  • chị Thy as project manager
  • This work is done for ltlt.company/trămđốt
